binaryattachment.name: BinaryAttachment
binaryattachment.description: An InboundEmail object stores binary attachments in an InboundEmail.BinaryAttachment object.

filename.name: fileName
filename.description: The name of the attached file.

headers.name: headers
headers.description: Any header values associated with the attachment. Examples of header names include Content-Type, Content-Transfer-Encoding, and Content-ID.

inboundemail.binaryattachment().name: InboundEmail.BinaryAttachment
inboundemail.binaryattachment().description: Creates a new instance of the Messaging.InboundEmail.BinaryAttachment class.

header.name: Header
header.description: An InboundEmail object stores RFC 2822 email header information in an InboundEmail.Header object with the following properties.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the header parameter, such as Date or Message-ID.

textattachment.name: TextAttachment
textattachment.description: An InboundEmail object stores text attachments in an InboundEmail.TextAttachment object.

bodyistruncated.name: bodyIsTruncated
bodyistruncated.description: Indicates whether the attachment body text is truncated (true) or not (false.)

charset.name: charset
charset.description: The original character set of the body field. The body is re-encoded as UTF-8 as input to the Apex method.

filename.name: fileName
filename.description: The name of the attached file.

headers.name: headers
headers.description: Any header values associated with the attachment. Examples of header names include Content-Type, Content-Transfer-Encoding, and Content-ID.

inboundemail.textattachment().name: InboundEmail.TextAttachment
inboundemail.textattachment().description: Creates a new instance of the Messaging.InboundEmail.TextAttachment class.

binaryattachments.name: binaryAttachments
binaryattachments.description: A list of binary attachments received with the email, if any.

ccaddresses.name: ccAddresses
ccaddresses.description: A list of carbon copy (CC) addresses, if any.

fromaddress.name: fromAddress
fromaddress.description: The email address that appears in the From field.

fromname.name: fromName
fromname.description: The name that appears in the From field, if any.

headers.name: headers
headers.description: A list of the RFC 2822 headers in the email.

htmlbody.name: htmlBody
htmlbody.description: The HTML version of the email, if specified by the sender.

htmlbodyistruncated.name: htmlBodyIsTruncated
htmlbodyistruncated.description: Indicates whether the HTML body text is truncated (true) or not (false.)

inreplyto.name: inReplyTo
inreplyto.description: The In-Reply-To field of the incoming email. Identifies the email or emails to which this one is a reply (parent emails). Contains the parent email or emails' message-IDs.

messageid.name: messageId
messageid.description: The Message-IDthe incoming email's unique identifier.

plaintextbody.name: plainTextBody
plaintextbody.description: The plain text version of the email, if specified by the sender.

plaintextbodyistruncated.name: plainTextBodyIsTruncated
plaintextbodyistruncated.description: Indicates whether the plain body text is truncated (true) or not (false.)

references.name: references
references.description: The References field of the incoming email. Identifies an email thread. Contains a list of the parent emails' References and message IDs, and possibly the In-Reply-To fields.

replyto.name: replyTo
replyto.description: The email address that appears in the reply-to header.

subject.name: subject
subject.description: The subject line of the email, if any.

textattachments.name: textAttachments
textattachments.description: A list of text attachments received with the email, if any.

inboundemail().name: InboundEmail
inboundemail().description: Creates a new instance of the Messaging.InboundEmail class.
